issue.title: world frame does not go with tf across network

content.raw:
It is not just the walk_test, keyboard_teleop has the same issue when you try to walk.  keyboard_teleop works when you move the arms or head, but when you walk, you need the world frame since the coordinates have to be sent in that frame, and it fails because it cannot find a world frame. 

 I always use try..........catch with transforms and do catch the error described here.  The issue is that "world" is not published with tf.    Look at the tree created with

```
#!python

rosrun tf view_frames
```
Not having world available is going to be a big problem for walking because there will be no way to command the foot to a position in the world frame and the control messages we have for walking use that frame.
